feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a functioning financial assistant: it collects investor inputs, classifies profiles, provides allocation examples, and generates portfolio analyses/visuals using market data (S&P modeling, 5‑ vs 10‑year comparisons). The student describes implementation and iterative improvement, meeting the criterion for a working financial app with substantive examples.
- Integrate AI: The student clearly integrated AI (built a GPT-based chatbot) and used it to generate substantive, value-adding outputs (profile-driven allocations, historical S&P visuals with sources). Iterative refinement and inclusion of sources/disclaimers demonstrate purposeful, non-superficial AI integration, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "Start everything by asking these three questions. What's your risk level? What's your investment horizon? What's the goal? How much money are you investing? And are there any restrictions? Um and it classifies the user profile and provides example for allocations."
"I use chat GBT to create my own GPT uh chatbot."
"So it has what's your modeling the S&P 500 represented with with dividends reinvested bonds by US Trevory and a balanced portfolio is 60% stocks 40% bonds like the classic diversified mix."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: defined goal to "build a AI assistant that helps us track financial tools" establishing the financial application objective.  
Implement: "I use chat GBT to create my own GPT uh chatbot" shows building the tool and prompts.  
Reflect: iterating on suggestions ("went back to the suggestions that Chad BT had for me") shows refinement of financial functionality.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a functioning financial assistant: it collects investor inputs, classifies profiles, provides allocation examples, and generates portfolio analyses/visuals using market data (S&P modeling, 5‑ vs 10‑year comparisons). The student describes implementation and iterative improvement, meeting the criterion for a working financial app with substantive examples.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "we wanted it to have uh a platform of our choice and it uses AI to explain, advise and analyze our financial queries."
"I use chat GBT to create my own GPT uh chatbot."
"So here you see the S&P 500 returns. Uh this is based on Bloomberg. So this is the growth in dollars growth of $1 invested in January 1926."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: defined the goal to "build a AI assistant that helps us track financial tools" and specified AI-driven capabilities (explain, advise, analyze).  
Implement: explicitly used ChatGPT to create a custom GPT chatbot with a main prompt and user-profile questions.  
Reflect: iteratively refined the assistant using ChatGPT suggestions to steer behavior and outputs.
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly integrated AI (built a GPT-based chatbot) and used it to generate substantive, value-adding outputs (profile-driven allocations, historical S&P visuals with sources). Iterative refinement and inclusion of sources/disclaimers demonstrate purposeful, non-superficial AI integration, meeting the PASS standard.
